Hi everyone. I've been away from Heritrix for a couple years but just got a=
sked to run it again against our web. I launched it with just over 51,000 s=
eeds, all of them using http (not https). It ran fine for a few days but no=
w it is freezing for long periods of time before it starts going again. (Mi=
nutes or hours... it has currently been stuck for an hour. There isn't anyt=
hing specific I've done to restart it before... it just mysteriously comes =
back to life.) I'm hoping for some ideas how to debug / improve this.

I se=
e the heritrix version 2 line seems to have been dropped (is this why?) and=
 versions 1 and 3 are being maintained. 3 seems still experimental / in pro=
gress? Do I need to redo my configs so I can switch to version 1?

Tech det=
ails (ask me what else you need)

Linux 2.6.18-128.1.16.el5.xs5.5.0.54xen r=
unning as a Virtual Machine

Heritrix started with JAVA_OPTS=3D"-Xmx3584M" =
(the most memory I could request before getting errors)

JAVA_HOME=3D/usr/l=
ocal/data/msimkin/java/jre1.6.0_20/

$ cat /proc/swaps
Filename				Type		Si=
ze	Used	Priority
/dev/mapper/VolGroup00-LogVol01         partition	4161528	=
2754248	-1

$ df -h .
Filesystem            Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted o=
n
192.168.70.100:/vol/infosec
                      2.0T  842G  1.1T  44% /=
usr/local/data

The "top" command reports (partial output)

top - 09:16:21 =
up 143 days,  9:05,  5 users,  load average: 1.00, 1.03, 1.21
Tasks:  98 to=
tal,   2 running,  95 sleeping,   0 stopped,   1 zombie
Cpu(s):  0.0%us,  0=
.2%sy,  0.0%ni, 50.2%id, 49.6%wa,  0.0%hi,  0.0%si,  0.0%st
Mem:   2097152k=
 total,  2088640k used,     8512k free,      336k buffers
Swap:  4161528k t=
otal,  2561512k used,  1600016k free,    10120k cached

  PID USER      PR =
 NI  VIRT  RES  SHR S %CPU %MEM    TIME+  COMMAND                          =
                                                                           =
                          
 8150 msimkin   15   0 3860m 1.6g 4752 S  0.0 78=
.8   1235:01 java                                                

I interp=
ret this to mean there is (virtual) memory available, and heritrix is not t=
rying to do anything that would use CPU. So what does it want?

When frozen=
, crawl.log shows no new entries, nor does heritrix_out.log or any other lo=
gfiles, not even progress-statistics.log. They all stop at about the same m=
inute and second. The web interface is also unresponsive, limiting diagnosi=
s there.

runtime-errors.log shows mostly complaints about character sets, =
and has no entries since 4 days ago.

About 3 minutes before the latest fre=
eze, nonfatal-errors.log shows the following burst of timeouts. (I am runni=
ng with 20 threads.)

2012-12-28T15:28:19.419Z    -2          - http://seam=
onkey.ed.asu.edu/swa/discussion/message117.html LLLLL http://wings.buffalo.=
edu/anthropology/Documents/lootbib.shtml unknown #016 - - - 
 java.net.Sock=
etTimeoutException: connect timed out: timeout set at 20000ms.

5:28:19.588Z    -2          - http://robots.asu.edu/index.php/Special:WhatL=
inksHere/MediaWiki_talk:Print.css ELL http://robots.asu.edu/index.php?title=

Research/roboticscamp/2009/mazevideo/mazevideo.html LLLLL http://venus.eas.=

pi/SimulationInfo_8cc.html LLLLLL http://shumway.physics.asu.edu/codes/doc/=

20psp&output=3Dxml_no_dtd&ie=3DUTF-8&client=3Dasu_frontend&proxystylesheet=

cketTimeoutException: connect timed out: timeout set at 20000ms.

I have co=
nfigured some sites to be crawled more slowly because of complaints about l=
oad. However if heritrix had nothing to do but wait for some configured pau=
ses to expire, I would expect the web interface at least to be responsive.
=

Ideas? Thanks!!!
